name: Computer Engineer
text: Computer engineers build devices, design computer networks and develop new technologies. They are focused on computer hardware and understanding how to optimize hardware for different applications

name: Electrical Engineer
text: Electrical engineers design, develop, and test electrical devices and equipment, including communications systems, power generators,

name: Textail Engineer
text: Textile engineering is a branch of engineering where the principles of scientific techniques are utilized for manufacturing and development of several varieties of fabric.

name: Bachelor Business Administration
text: In the United States, the degree is conferred after four years of full-time study in one or more areas of business concentrations. In Europe and India, the degree is conferred

name: Civil Engineer
text: Civil engineers create, improve and protect the environment in which we live. They plan, design and oversee construction and maintenance of building structures and infrastructure,

name: Architectural engineering
text: Architectural Engineers use mathematical and scientific principles in building design to test, evaluate, and improve the structural integrity of buildings and building systems

name: Mechanical Engineer
text: Mechanical engineers design power-producing machines, such as electric generators, internal combustion engines, and steam and gas turbines, as well as power-using machines,

name: Software Engineer
text: A software engineer is a person who applies the principles of software engineering to design, develop, maintain, test, and evaluate computer software. The term programmer is sometimes

name: Master Business Administration
text: A Master of Business Administration (MBA; also Master's in Business Administration) is a graduate degree focusing on business administration, investment management, healthcare administration and psychology.
